snippet: Latino voters tipped the balance in at least three swing states, securing their position as an organized force in American politics.
abstract: Latino voters turned out in record numbers, choosing Pres Barack Obama by wide margins, tipping balance in at least three swing states and securing their position as an organized force in American politics with power to move national elections.

byline.original: By JULIA PRESTON and FERNANDA SANTOS

lead_paragraph: Latino voters tipped the balance in at least three swing states, securing their position as an organized force in American politics.

headline.seo: With Record Turnout, Latinos Solidly Back Obama and Wield Influence
headline.main: A Record Latino Turnout, Solidly Backing Obama
headline.print_headline: A Record Latino Turnout, Solidly Backing Obama
